title: Business News:  Walmart  Aims to Fill  Crypto Role  ---  Retailer advertises  job that entails  developing strategy  for digital currencies  ----  By Omar Abdel-Baqui
text:
Walmart Inc. is seeking to hire a cryptocurrency expert, joining a growing number of companies looking to develop strategies for digital currencies such as bitcoin.

The retailer posted a job for a digital-currency and cryptocurrency product lead based at its Bentonville, Ark., headquarters.

The hire would be expected to "commit to a product roadmap and drive the project execution" and serve as an expert on the job's subject matter, according to the posting.

The job posting says the person it hires will "identify customer needs and translate them into product requirements" and that he or she will work with product and design teams.

Amazon.com Inc. in July similarly posted an opening for an expert in digital currency.

Walmart didn't respond to a request to comment.

Bitcoin's daily trading volume and price began climbing in late July, even as traders face uncertainty over proposed tax regulations in Washington.

Companies including Starbucks Corp. and Home DepotInc. accept cryptocurrency indirectly, through third-party applications that convert digital currency into dollars.

Walmart is no stranger to blockchain, the technology behind the record-keeping system of cryptocurrencies.

The retailer has used the technology to manage supply-chain data in a way that is simpler and more secure than the traditional array of bar codes, scanners, paper forms and individual databases.
